reviewText:
Not only did this movie come from a true story, but it was a great story.
And on top of this it was very well told with an all star cast including Forest Whitaker, Isaiah Washington, and others you'll recognize.

The movie shows just enough of Katrina footage to remind us of the travesty of the storm and our handling of the aftermath - but it does not over do it.  Then it moves on at a perfect pace to the story of rebuilding. It comes with inspiring words balanced with a real glimpse of the dirty and slow process it was in New Orleans.

It's crazy that this never hit the big screen because it was so good, because it was a true story, and because it had an Academy Award Winner and stars like Lil Wayne.

It really should sit on everyone's shelf along side your true story sports classics like The Blind Side, Hoosiers, More than a Game, Glory Road, Miracle, Cinderella Man, Brian's Song, and Remember the Titans.

This movie should have been seen on the big screen. The story we all know was sad due to the loss of so many lives during Hurricane Katrina. But the story of these students/basketball players and their coaches was inspiring. My sons and I have watched it at least 5 times since it aired on television and another 3 times since we purchased the DVD from Amazon.com
This was a good movie and the setting was real touchy, because that really did happen down south, but I really enjoyed it showed Unity.
Great movie, the cast I thought would ruin it (not Forester) but yeah they did well and the movie was very good, not depressing just a great movie!! I highly reccomend!
Though very subtle, the type design on the opening and closing credits were, in my opinion, ground breaking.

Hello all, well I must say that this movie was REALLY good... WHY you ask well let me tell you...:)

Ok, This movie shows you that people can work through almost anything if not anything... It also shows that some folks pain causes them to to act out in hurtful ways..yet God being God always sends someone to pull you OUT of that pain so you can LIVE again!!!

5 BIG STARS!!!!!!!!!

LOVED IT!!

PS
Its a all star cast.. Alot of nice young actors!!!

This is a great movie.  Every time I watched the movie I was reminded of how blessed we really are to still be alive. I laughed, cried, and cheered throughout the movie.  I thought about how Hurricane Katrina had affected the people of News Orleans but it did not kill their spirits.  These boys along with their coach fought through all odds and became a family and winners.

Very good DVD and story based on true events during and after Katrina.  It was an emotional movie, seeing the devastation and horror of what happened to the lives of different people after this terrible storm.

There are some off color sexual remarks by the crazy bus driver on the first bus trip about comparing driving the old bus to making love to an old woman--so if you have kids, be aware of that part. I really enjoyed this movie. It was very well done.

.. it wouldn't have gotten 3 stars.  Even he had a hard time bringing a forced dialogue to believability.  The fact that the story was true kept my attention because I know that area.  But that area was devastated by Hurricane Katrina, and there were indeed people who carried on and pulled things together in the face of unbelievable conditions.  Any triumph arising from those conditions was important and deserved a better telling than it got in this film.

This movie was filled with all of the emotions we experienced after Hurricane Katrina.  The movie gave an overview of life after the hurricane, failed government leadership and the courage of the people.  I watch this movie twice a week.

Its a great story about rival high school teams who join forces after Hurricane Katrina destroys everything around them.  Loads of basketball in it.  Memorable momments are forcing the team "ball hog" to play one on 4 and fail.

Excellent movie I was touched by the story line and the characters.  For something so positive to come out of Katrina's devastation really warms my heart.  Forrest Whitaker is one of my favorite actors and he really did an wonderful portrayal  of the coach who put together a stellar basketball team out of literally rubble-a phoenix if ever there was one.
